result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard B Mahone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management counseling.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the victim without approval from the agent.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and DV); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

 Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Jury trial date of 06/16/2015 is vacated.

Defendant Leonard B Mahone in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Court ordered charge amended to Battery (Domestic Violence), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 973.055(1) and 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Leonard B Mahone in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Case also remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on 06/16/15 at 9:00am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. Defendant has valid prescription.  Court does not take action at this time.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Court declines action due to defendant's valid prescription.

Defendant Leonard B Mahone in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Thomas L. Potter for Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Court also addressed the Justice Point report.  Victim Witness MC was able to confirm that the victim has moved out of the defendant's residence.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Leonard B Mahone in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Nathaniel Adamson for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/3/15.
css
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Danielle M.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leonard B Mahone in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Leonard B Mahone in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
